indicator.title: Output Indicator
indicator.description: 1. Availability of TV drama series in three local languages on public service reform. 2. Dialogue fora on piloted public service reform (PSR) conducted. 3. No of civil servants trained at MDI. 4. National Volunteer Policy/Act formulated and enacted. 5. # of activities executed by VolNet. 6. # of staff trained on gov.gm

baseline.comment: 1.No dialogue fora on PSR conducted. 2.35 middle level, 105 senior level and 67 junior level civil servants trained in 2011. 3.No National Volunteer Policy/Act. 4.26 government agencies linked and 1147 e-mail accounts created

target.comment: 1. Support the upgrade of skills and training of existing civil servants and civil service oriented institutions such as MDI for performance-based management. 2. Strengthen volunteering infrastructure to address existing human resources capacity gaps and encourage transfer of skills. 3. Continue to support the implementation of e-governance for effective and efficient public service delivery in support of the implementation of Civil Service Reform Strategy (CSR).

actual.comment: 1.Three main documents ( Strategic Plan, Resource Mobilisation Strategy and a Study on Pay and Incentives) were prepared enabled MDI to retain highly qualified trainers for resource mobilization and self-financing sustainability through increased collaboration with other institutions and departments especially in the area of training. This resulted to 80% increase in training and resource mobilization from government and private sector 2.A total of 50 senior government officials (DPSs and PASs) were trained on 5 day training on policy formulation. It has enabled the civil service to effectively formulate and implement policies and enable them to identify shortcomings in sector policy formulation and implementation. It also improved management and efficiency in service delivery and helped them to produce quality policies that attract donor’s vis-à-vis aid effectiveness e.g. the newly formulated vision 2016.

target.comment: 1. Strengthen performance audit practice and establish performance audit unit. 2. Support PAC & PEC committees to enhance accountability

iati-activity.title: Strengthened Capacities of Gov
iati-activity.description: Strengthened capacities of governance institutions responsible for accountability, justice and participation at all levels

country-budget-items.budget-item: Other General Services - support to civil society

Money is disbursed directly to the implementing institution and managed through a separate bank account

indicator.title: Output Indicator
indicator.description: 1. # of people accessing legal aid and ADR services 2. # of oversight institutions capacity built on Public Finance Accountability and # of staff trained on PFA; 3. # of fora on citizen engagement and social audit conducted; 4. Action Plan (AP) developed for implementation of 2010 Universal Peer Review (UPR) 5. Gender Policy strategic plan implemented 6. # of beneficiaries from civic education and advocacy 7. # of Local Governance Authorities (LGAs) trained on human rights 8. Policy and legal framework for PLHIV AIDS reviewed and strengthened 9. HIV/AIDS related stigma and discrimination study validated and disseminated 10. Functional and effective PMU for implementation of project activities. 11. Programme Delivery rate of UNDP CO. 12. # of programme and financial Monitoring and Evaluation Reports 13. # of Audit exercises conducted

baseline.comment: 1. Number of people accessing services from Regional Legal Aid Service Centre: 463 2. staff trained on PFA 0 3. Fora on citizen engagement and social audit conducted on adhoc basis; 4. No Action Plan for implementation of 2010 UPR 5. No Gender Policy strategic plan implemented 6. No LGAs' staff trained on Human Rights. 7. No updated Policy and Legal Framework for PLHIV AIDS. 8.No study on HIV/AIDS related stigma and discrimination study. 9. Support provided for implementation of project activities ( 80% programme delivery rate of UNDP CO in 2011; Quarter Review Reports; 3 and Annual Report: 1; Evaluation Reports: 2; Audit exercise conducted)

target.comment: 1.Number of people access to ADR and Legal Aid services at decentralized level ADR: 200, Legal Aid: 50; 2. Establishment of web-based case management system and capacity of judiciary personnel enhanced. 3. Number of oversight institutions strengthened: 2. 4. Strategic Plan for Ministry of Justice formulated. 5. Database system for AGDI established. 6. Awareness on civic education and human rights increased in 7 regions. 7. Capacities of 9 PLHIV networks and groups increased.

actual.comment: NALA provided legal aid services to 1045 clients whilst 114 people benefitted from ADR quick and cost effective service delivery. Skills of 130 conflict mediation and resolutions mediators (80% women) were enhanced following training workshops in 7 regions. Awareness raising and capacity building of journalist on ethics and communication rights is creating a more conductive environment for journalist to operate in a more professional and effective manner. Established functional community policing is popular in the communities and is bridging the gap and misunderstandings between the police and the community. First strategic plan. 2015 - 2019 for the Ministry of Justice has been validated. Through media sensitization, dialogues and establishment of clubs in secondary schools carried out by the NCCE, citizen’s civic awareness has been substantially increased, broadening key community members’ knowledge on decentralization, local governance, resource allocation and budget processes and participatory rural appraisal. HIV Strategic plan validated and finalized and document is printed. It serves as a direction for HIV/AIDS intervention in the country and for resource mobilization to tackle funding gaps and coordination of activities to reduce duplication of activity CO supported the preparation of a concept note to the Global Fund funds disbursement will start in 2015. There are still funding gaps in the strategic plan and more resources need to be mobilized.

target.comment: 1.Capacity development in Para Legal training (4), 2.Support implementation of Ministry of Justice strategic plan. 3.Support study tours to learn best practices on the establishment of an Anti corruption Agency and the National Human Rights Commission. 4.Facilitate a Needs Assessment Mission on Electoral Support.

indicator.title: Output Indicator

baseline.comment: 1. No Skill gap analysis report produced: 2. Limited number of people received apprenticeship training; 3. No Tracer study on TVET conducted; 4. No Agro based incubation center established and operationalized: 5. No LMIS established 6. 2 employment staff trained on employment & labour administration system: 7. No dialogue forum for PPP held and action plan developed: 8. Awareness on employment issues increased; advocacy through TV and radio and newsletters: started in 2012 9. No drama group on employment issues.

target.comment: 1. Support the expansion of vocational, entrepreneurship, business management skills training, and operationalization of business incubators among disadvantaged and vulnerable groups in two pilot regions. 2. Capacity building of relevant departments of the Ministry of Trade and other related institutions to encourage private entrepreneurship, competitiveness and facilitate trade and investment. 3. Support fora for public-private sector consultation and dialogue on employment issues established.

actual.comment: 1. 30 apprentices were trained by 10 Master Craft Persons (MCPs) in CRR North on auto mechanics, welding & Fabrication and Tailoring. 2. 50 youths were recruited by PIA to be trained on tailoring and hair dressing for one year. 3. 80 women in Banjulingding, 60 in Sami Badala, 100 Jamlay and 60 in Nyagen women’s Garden were trained on business management skills, leadership & marketing for a period 45days. The training improved their management skills and leadership. It also helped them to sell their products. 4. Assessment of skills centre is completed and the final report submitted to the beneficiary National Training Authority (NTA). The report would help identify the relevant skills centres that have the capacity to conduct skills and entrepreneurship training.

target.comment: 1. Support entrepreneurship capacity development at all levels to increase the contribution of SMEs to growth, employment creation and poverty reduction. 2. Train 400 entrepreneurs and 200 Business Development Services providers. Entrepreneurship development center established. 3. Strengthen national capacity for entrepreneurship development, promotion of marketable skills and best practice on youth employment endeavors. 4. Strengthen capacity of the employment / investment and labour directorates and also update national employment policy.

iati-activity.title: Small Producers Access & Utili
iati-activity.description: Small producers, particularly women, youths and vulnerable groups, access and utilize productive resources and markets through value addition facilities and services.

indicator.title: Output Indicator

baseline.comment: 1. No of knowledge products produced. 2. No value addition of primary commodities: 3. No assessment of situation of women's access and ownership to land and other productive resource.

target.comment: Two issue based knowledge products and tools addressing barriers to strategic directions of Small and Medium Enterprises (SMEs) development, particularly for women and youths in selected regions produced. 2. Four value addition of primary commodities on sites in terms of processing, marketing and distribution by small producers particularly women, youths and vulnerable groups supported.

actual.comment: 1. 318 people trained in phase 1 of Entrepreneurship Training Workshops (ETWs) 2. 106 trained on Business Development Services (BDS) and 26 BDS advisers are providing BDS services to Entrepreneurs already trained in ETWs. 60 people were trained on business management, leadership and marketing skills to enhanced their entrepreneur skills. 3. Gambia Investment and Export Promotion Agency (GIEPA) capacity strengthened to manage the EMPRETEC Project. 4. Assessment of the impact of the GCCI Business Award on the competitiveness of the business sector’ was completed and validated. The recommendations of the study were presented to the board for consideration. 5. Two Findi processing machines installed and started processing. The processing machines have reduced the work load for women and neighboring villages also use the facility. The community also generated some income from the processing machines. 6. 30000 litres capacity of water is available for the Nyagen pepper processing plant. 7. 15 ovens and a generator were provided for oyster processing for 500 oyster producers in the country and a 5 year strategic business plan developed, ready to be supported by donors.

target.comment: 1. 80 youths benefitting from agricultural transformation for growth and employment generation capacity development training. 2. Best practice learning on cluster development and industrial estate facilitated.

iati-activity.title: Sustainable use of environment
iati-activity.description: Support and promote community based natural resources management initiatives such as ecotourism.

indicator.title: Output Indicator

target.comment: 1. Support and promote community based natural resources management initiatives such as ecotourism.

actual.comment:
1. An assessment on modern beekeeping techniques was conducted in May 2014 outlining the status in terms of the progress registered and the challenges faced by the trained Community Forestry (CF) and Joint Forest Park Management (JFPM) committees in Kombo North and CRR North. Assessment report produced.
2. The construction of 10 benches, 2 information boards, Landing Getty and a waiting shed constructed in Kunkilling to improve access, raise awareness, attract more visitors, increase income generation level and eventually enhance sustainable forest conservation. Kunkilling attracted 48 visitors in October and the committee opened a bank account with Reliance.

target.comment: 1. Enhance sustainable use of environmental resources through training of 10 wildlife rangers, development of at least one by-laws and 4 management plan for community protected areas, tree planting, woodlots, training on modern honey production and development of a brochure on the flora and fauna. 2. Construct Basic Park and cultural infrastructure as eco tourist site for local income generation. 3. Preparation of biodiversity Project Preparation Grant (PPG) and develop capacity on nursery management and facilitate national participation in international meetings (COPS).

iati-activity.description: UNDP/GEF Strengthening Climate Change and Early Warning System Project in The Gambia is an LDCF financed project, implemented by the Ministry of the Environment, Climate Change, Water, Forestry & Wildlife (MoECCWFW).

iati-activity.description: UNDP/GEF Strengthening Climate Change and Early Warning System Project in The Gambia.

baseline.comment: 1. No Project document. 2. Weak institutional capacity (60 trained staff out of 135 people) in climate monitoring, early warning systems to respond to climate shocks, with low budgets, inadequate staffing and dilapidated equipment and infrastructure.

target.comment: 1.Inception workshop, and Local Project Appraisal Committee Meeting (LPAC) done.

actual.comment: 1.Project document available implementation to start in earnest.

target.comment: 1. Project implementation started in earnest. 2. Capacities of institutions enhanced through training of 115 staff out of 135. 3. Adequate budget provided and modern equipment and infrastructure for climate data generation, processing and dissemination procured.

iati-activity.title: Enhancing Resilience of Vulnerable Communities & Areas
iati-activity.description: The risk of climate change induced damage to human and economic development in coastal areas of The Gambia is mounting with sea level rise and coastal erosion.

document-link.title: Enhancing Resilience of Vulnerable Communities & Areas
Enhancing Resilience of Vulnerable Communities & Areas
Enhancing Resilience of Vulnerable Communities & Areas

iati-activity.title: Environmental Sustainability
iati-activity.description: Enhancing Resilience of Vulnerable Coastal Areas and Communities to Climate Change.

Money is disbursed directly to the implementing institution and managed through a separate bank account
Money is disbursed directly to the implementing institution and managed through a separate bank account

indicator.title: Output Indicator

target.comment: 1. Purchase & Delivery of Project Equipment and Furniture to National Environment Agency. 2. Identification of Alternative livelihoods including for Salt troubled Communities. 3. Training of 5 technicians on improving the roles of key Institutions in Sea and River Disaster Risk Management 4. Perimeter fencing of the five community gardens in Foni Bintang, Bondali Tenda, Kiang Misera, Toubakolong and Illiassa to support Alternative livelihoods. 5. Construction of Store at project Implementation Unit (PIU) complex for alternative livelihoods materials and equipment storage before community beneficiaries deliveries. 6. Provision of complete water supply system for the four (4) community gardens of Foni Bintang, Bondali Tenda, Kiang Misera and Illiassa to support Alternative livelihoods. 7. Supply of boulders for Temporary erosion control at Tanji Bridge. 8. Conduct studies on feasibility of hard coastal construction and also develop plans and policies for climate risk management.

actual.comment: 1. All targets for the year have been achieved except "Training of technicians on improving the roles of key Institutions in Sea and River Disaster Risk Management" where only 28 out of 250 were trained. 2. Study report on mangrove die back produced. 3. Study report on Sea and river risk deference management produced. 4. An assessment of community livelihood interventions produced.

target.comment: 1. Regulatory requirements for works at Senegambia/Tanji,Tendaba,Darsilami and Illiassa. 2. Identification of Contractors for village defense works in Tendaba. 3. Identification of Contractors for coastal defense works in Senegambia/Kololi and Tanji Bridge. 4. Support to alternative livelihood activities and programs. 5. A study on mangrove restoration planning completed and mangrove replanting commenced: 6. Execute village defense works in Tendaba. 7. Execute Integrated Farming System in Darsilami and Illiassa. 8. Execute coastal defense works in Senegambia/Kololi and Tanji Bridge.

result.title: Objective
result.description: To reduce Gambia’s vulnerability to sea-level rise and associated impacts of climate change by improving coastal defences and enhancing adaptive capacities of coastal communities

indicator.title: Indicator 1
indicator.description: Number of vulnerable people / communities with enhanced living conditions and sustainable livelihoods.

baseline.comment:
Zero within government sector, minimal and sporadic in tourist sector.
Zero – existing communities affected by negative climate impacts (socio-economic and / or environmental)

target.comment:
Investment level reaches an additional USD $15m for sea and river defences allied to risk reduction approach.
All target communities / wards experience positive improvements and sustainable livelihoods.

actual.comment:
Designs for Sea & River defense produced for three locations as follows: Senegambia/Kololi Beach, Tanji Bridge and Tendaba. Supervisors for the construction of designs for Senegambia/Kololi and Tendaba already identified.
Designs for a farming system that integrates rice cultivation, fish farming and salt production produced for Dasilami and Illiasa; short-list of candidates for supervision of the construction activity produced

result.title: Outcome 1
result.description: Policies, institutions and individuals mandated to manage coastal areas strengthened to reduce the risk of climate change.

indicator.title: Indicator 1
indicator.description:
Climate risk management, sea and river risk management and technical capacity in relevant national and regional institutions.
Coastal monitoring procedure undertaken, collated in database and accessible to support decision-making.
Number of Sea and River Defence Investment Plans actually financed

baseline.comment:
Negligible except in NEA and DWR.
Very limited monitoring database.
None

target.comment:
Capacity to implement climate risk management in national institutions and target regional entities. 250 Technicians trained in total (50 technical staff drawn from national departments; 200 extension staff drawn from relevant regional agricultural, engineering, planning and fisheries directorates)
Monitoring data collected and stored in structured and accessible database.
Sea and River Defence policy and investment management plans (SRDIMPs); Code of Practice for Sea and River Defence Structures & Coastal Development developed. SRDIMP developed - 1 per each coastal district

actual.comment:
Thirteen technical staff trained from national departments and fifteen (15) extension staff trained from the regions.
Not much of monitoring data collected during period as M & E Officer was largely not available; project will make of use monitoring database being developed by the EU-Global Climate Change Alliance project also being implemented by National Environment Agency
Guidance manual on Sea & River Defense Risk Management produced

result.title: Outcome 2
result.description: Vulnerability of coastal investments to climate risks reduced through the design, construction and maintenance of coastal protection measures.

indicator.title: Indicator 1
indicator.description:
Number of hard and soft coastal protection schemes implemented to reduce erosion risks
Number of families benefiting from LDCF resources used for design and build structures

baseline.comment:
No functioning hard or soft protection (or redundant legacy structures) at target sites.
Vulnerable communities to climate change in coastal and estuarine areas are becoming in higher risk without adaptation measures

target.comment:
2 Hard and 3 soft protection schemes planned and implemented
1,500 families will benefit directly from protection measures

actual.comment:
Studies completed and designs for two hard engineering protection measures produced for Senegambia/Kololi beach and Tanji Bridge. Designs for soft engineering measures produced for the three locations of Dasilami, Illiasa and Tendaba. Supervisors identified for construction works in Senegambia/Kololi and Tanji Bridge (same supervisor) and also for Tendaba
More than 1500 families expected to benefit at the completion and operation of the measures

result.title: Outcome 3
result.description: Rural livelihoods in the coastal zone enhanced and protected from the impacts of climate change through the demonstration and the transfer of successful coastal adaptation technologies and the introduction of economic diversification

indicator.title: Indicator 1
indicator.description:
Rice and fish production to produce sustainable income for local community.
Number of farmers that will receive agricultural extension services and alternative livelihoods

baseline.comment:
Uneconomic / degraded rice production and no fish ranching production in target communities.
No / negligible knowledge on farmers that will receive agricultural extension.

target.comment: Rice and fish production represent economic sustainable livelihood activity for community members in. 20 wards in the Lower and Central Valleys 1,500 rice growers and 300 horticulture producers diversity income.

actual.comment: Design for an integrated rice, salt and fish farming scheme produced for Dasilami and Illiasa communities; working at ward level is not practical. Five communities received support in horticulture with combined beneficiaries of 671 men and female that is expected to increase

indicator.description: 1. Full Size Project developed. 2. Increase protected area coverage. 3. Enhanced understanding of communities on biodiversity conservation.

baseline.comment: 1. No project document. 2. Current overall Protected Area estate is 64,276 ha. 3. Target communities have inadequate understanding of biodiversity conservation, PA, natural resources and sustainable land management concepts.

target.comment: 1. Medium sized project document produced. 2. Additional 15, 000 hectares of land designated as PA. 3. Increase awareness and understanding of communities on biodiversity conservation issues.

actual.comment: 1.Project document produced, validated and submitted to GEF for approval.

target.comment: 1.Finalize project document, obtain GEF approval and launch of project.

indicator.title: Output Indicator
indicator.description: 1. Increase awareness and strengthen capacity for early detection and prevention. 2. High level of coordination among all actors. 3. Availability of a functional system to manage case.

baseline.comment: 1. No Ebola reported. 2. Low awareness on Ebola in the country and lack of early detection and preventive capacity.

target.comment: 1. Develop full blown proposal for Japanese Government funding.

actual.comment: 1. Project approved to expand and continue on the prevention, preparedness and readiness of the country. 2. Increased awareness created.

target.comment: 1. Coordination mechanism put in place to coordinate all Ebola related interventions. 2. Functional Early Warning system established. 3. Health centers upgraded to manage possible case of Ebola. 4. Increased awareness of the public on Ebola and its transmission mechanism.

iati-activity.title: Support to National Ebola Prev
iati-activity.description: Support The Gambia’s National Ebola Virus Disease Plan (NEVDP) & is to improve national capacities to implement the NEVDP, by enhancing national response capacities and preparedness levels.

country-budget-items.budget-item: Social Protection, Land Housing and Community Amenities - disaster prevention and preparedness

transaction.disbursement-channel: Money is disbursed directly to the implementing institution and managed through a separate bank account

indicator.title: Output Indicator
indicator.description: 1.Number of coordination meetings taking place regularly at national and regional level. 2.Number of Health workers training to deal adequately with EVD. 3. Number of awareness creation and social mobilization activities completed on EVD preparedness and response plan. 4. Availability of a system to effectively manage case, early detection and referral systems and mechanisms.

baseline.comment: 1. Absence of a Central Emergency Command Centre with the necessary vehicles and equipment. 2. Inadequate transport facilities to undertake coordination, monitoring and evaluation activities at field level. 3. Absence of a national Project Coordination Unit for EVD prevention and control. 4. Stakeholder meetings are not conducted on a regular basis, particularly at regional level. 5. Inadequate resources to conduct bimonthly supervisory visits. 6. Lack of skills in EVD prevention and management, especially at community level. 7. IHR (2005) not utilized as the basis for health interventions.

target.comment: 1. Central Emergency Command Centre operational and fully equipped with computers and well connected VHF radio network. 2.35 border officers and 105 community-based nurses trained on EVD prevention and control. 3.100% of Rapid Response Teams trained on surveillance and early detection. 4.35 field surveillance officers (5 per Region) trained on contact tracing, reporting and follow-up. 5.100 Community Health Nurses trained on community case-based definition of alert cases of EVD, using Training of Trainers approach. 6. Drama groups and traditional communicators engaged to conduct national sensitization campaigns on EVD. 7. EVD sensitization campaigns conducted in each region. 8. Increased levels of awareness on EVD prevention and detection, particularly at local community level. 9.Temporary holding facilities established and equipped at three Points of Entry.
